intro: Phyteuma rapunculus, commonly known as the meadow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, thriving in well-drained soils. It has a basal rosette of leaves and produces slender, branching stems that bear the showy flowers. Phyteuma rapunculus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive appearance and ease of growth.
